item.title: Report X-2025010810
item.description:
Report X-2025010810

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-23T21:13:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-13
  • City: SEATAC
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the SEAR location a damaged fiberboard ripped open showing the contents to be undeclared DG. Inside of a the fiberboard box was a smaller box labeled as a UN1070 there were no markings or paperwork on the outer box. The shipment was placed into a steel salvage package and is being held for the FAA.

item.title: Report X-2025010711
item.description:
Report X-2025010711

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-30
  • City: SEATTLE
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: outer package/fibreboard box damaged in transit to reveal undeclared dg in inner packaging. 2 metal bottles of nitrous oxide. inner package was marked and labeled with proper shipping name, un number, and hazard labels. no release. secured in salvage drum pending FAA inspection.

item.title: Report E-2025010198
item.description:
Report E-2025010198

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-23T21:13:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-21
  • City: RENTON
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 07:05 EST, ERTS was contacted by XPO Logistics (USE) about a cargo release. It was reported that due to improper loading, approximately .25 cup of System 15-System XFR (hazardous - UN1133) was released. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the trailer floor. The terminal advised they already cleaned and contained the release. The released product, damaged can, and oil-dri was placed into a 5-gallon poly drum and staged in OS&D. There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release.
